com.sun.xml.wss
Interface MessageFilter

All Known Implementing Classes:
AddNamespaceFilter, AuthorizationFilter, CreateSamlAssertionFilter, DecryptReferenceListFilter, DumpFilter, EncryptElementFilter, ExportCertificateTokenFilter, ExportEncryptedKeyFilter, ExportReferenceListFilter, ExportSamlAssertionFilter, ExportSignatureFilter, ExportTimestampFilter, ExportUsernameTokenFilter, FilterBase, ImportCertificateTokenFilter, ImportEncryptedKeyFilter, ImportReferenceListFilter, ImportSamlAssertionFilter, ImportTimestampFilter, ImportUsernameTokenFilter, ProcessSecurityHeaderFilter, SetSecurityEnvironmentFilter, SignFilter, TeeFilter, VerifyFilter
public interface MessageFilter

The MessageFilter interface represents an operation on a securable SOAP message such as signing, encrypting, or verifying a signature. 

                            ------------------
                            |                  |
    SecurableSOAPMessage -->|  MessageFilter   |--> SecurableSOAPMessage
                            |                  |    (transformed)
                            ------------------
The input is a SOAPMessage and the output is typically a transformed SOAPMessage. MessageFilters may be configured via their constructor parameters in order to provide variations on a particular type of transformation. MessageFilters are stateless, as a result any information created as a byproduct of their execution must be stored within the SecurableSoapMessage that they operated on. This allows heterogeneous operations to be represented and composed into pipelines.

For a more concrete description, each implementation class should have at least one constructor which takes a set of configuration parameters for the particular operation and stores those in the instance for use in the process() method. An application typically creates single a pipeline for processing SecurableSoapMessages in a particular context and then reuses that pipeline for all SecurableSoapMessages in that context.

setKeyInfoStrategyParameter

public void setKeyInfoStrategyParameter(KeyInfoStrategy strategy)
Sets the KeyInfoStrategy that this filter will use. Overrides string version of the same parameter if it exists.

Parameters:
strategy - the strategy to use

process

public void process(SecurableSoapMessage secureMessage)
             throws XWSSecurityException
Invokes the MessageFilter on the SOAPMessage sm. A XWSSecurityException is thrown if the operation did not succeed.

Throws:
XWSSecurityException - if the operation did not succeed
